item.title: TL;DR - Hybrid Public Key Encryption
item.description: HPKE is a CFRG RFC that describes a scheme for hybrid public key encryption. It is co-authored by my Cryspen co-founder Karthikeyan Bhargavan and one of his PhD students Benjamin Lipp as part of his research at Inria. This blog post will give a brief overview of the specification and describes some use cases. If you want to learn more about the security proofs behind HPKE and the RFC process, Benjamin wrote an excellent blog post about it.
